flightsim.simconnect.wrappers
Class AnnotationWrapper

java.lang.Object
  flightsim.simconnect.wrappers.AnnotationWrapper

public class AnnotationWrapper
extends java.lang.Object

AnnotationWrapper is an helper class to automatically build definitions and handles wrapping/unwrapping mapping FS data to Java class. It is a per-simconnect session object, which means that you'll have to create and initialize it each time you connect or reconnect to FS.

Data classes (usually POJO beans) must be registered prior to use, with registerClass(Class). Then the class can be used to build request with requestSimObjectData(Class, int, SimConnectPeriod, boolean). The AnnotationWrapper can create objects using unwrap(RecvSimObjectData) from a RecvSimObjectData response packets. Don't try to alter the receive buffer before calling this method or it could break

An example use is the following: 

//
// data class to use
public class SampleDataClass {
        // bean constructor
        public SampleDataClass() {

        }








Author:

  
lc0277

AnnotationWrapper


public AnnotationWrapper(SimConnect sc)




Create a new annotation wrapper for a SimConnect session





Parameters:
sc - simconnect instance

Throws:

java.lang.NullPointerException - if sc is null








AnnotationWrapper


public AnnotationWrapper(SimConnect sc,
                         int startDefID,
                         int startReqID)




Create a new annotation wrapper for a SimConnect session. If requestSimObjectData(Class, int, SimConnectPeriod, boolean)
 is called without requestID parameter, the wrapper will pick a new one starting
 at the given index





Parameters:
sc - simconnect instance
startDefID - starting index for data definition ids
startReqID - starting index for request ids

Throws:

java.lang.NullPointerException - if sc is null












Method Detail







setStartDefinitionID


public void setStartDefinitionID(int startID)




Sets the starting index for building data definition ID. use this method if you let
 this annotationwrapper choose identifiers for you. Default value is 0





Parameters:
startID - 










setStartRequestID


public void setStartRequestID(int startID)




Sets the starting index for building data request ID. use this method if you let
 this annotationwrapper choose identifiers for you. Default value is 0





Parameters:
startID - 










registerClass


public int registerClass(java.lang.Class<?> c)
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         IllegalDataDefinition




Register a class prior to use. This is mandatory before calling requestSimObjectData(Class, int, SimConnectPeriod, boolean)
 or unwrap(RecvSimObjectData) or setSimObjectData(Object, int)





Parameters:
c - class to use

Returns:
data definition value (automatically choosed from starting index, see setStartDefinitionID(int))

Throws:

IllegalDataDefinition - if the class c contains invalid or non-mappable fields

java.io.IOException - SimConnect IO Errors










registerClass


public int registerClass(java.lang.Enum dataDefID,
                         java.lang.Class<?> c)
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         IllegalDataDefinition




Register a class prior to use. This is mandatory before calling requestSimObjectData(Class, int, SimConnectPeriod, boolean)
 or unwrap(RecvSimObjectData) or setSimObjectData(Object, int)





Parameters:
c - class to use
dataDefID - force data definition ID

Returns:
data definition ID (here dataDefID)

Throws:

IllegalDataDefinition - if the class c contains invalid or non-mappable fields

java.io.IOException - SimConnect IO Errors

0.7

requestSimObjectData


public int requestSimObjectData(java.lang.Class<?> cl,
                                int objectId,
                                SimConnectPeriod period,
                                boolean onlyWhenChanged)
                         throws java.io.IOException,
                                IllegalDataDefinition




Request SimObject data from a class. The class must be registered before using this method (see registerClass(Class)).
 See SimConnect.requestDataOnSimObject(Enum, Enum, int, SimConnectPeriod) for
 more informations on this simconnect request.





Parameters:
cl - class to use. must be registered
objectId - object ID, or SimConnectConstants.OBJECT_ID_USER for user aircraft
period - period, see SimConnectPeriod
onlyWhenChanged - set to true if you want to receive data only if it was changed

Returns:
ID of request (picked up from starting index, see setStartRequestID(int)

Throws:

java.io.IOException - simconnect error

IllegalDataDefinition - if this class was not registered










requestSimObjectData


public int requestSimObjectData(java.lang.Class<?> cl,
                                java.lang.Enum requestId,
                                int objectId,
                                SimConnectPeriod period,
                                boolean onlyWhenChanged)
                         throws java.io.IOException,
                                IllegalDataDefinition




Request SimObject data from a class. The class must be registered before using this method (see registerClass(Class)).
 See SimConnect.requestDataOnSimObject(Enum, Enum, int, SimConnectPeriod) for
 more informations on this simconnect request.





Parameters:
cl - class to use. must be registered
objectId - object ID, or SimConnectConstants.OBJECT_ID_USER for user aircraft
requestId - forced request id
period - period, see SimConnectPeriod
onlyWhenChanged - set to true if you want to receive data only if it was changed

Returns:
ID of request (here requestId)

Throws:

java.io.IOException - simconnect error

IllegalDataDefinition - if this class was not registered
Since:

  
0.7

                                 int objectId)
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             IllegalDataDefinition




Set SimObject data from a managed class





Parameters:
data - value
objectId - object id

Throws:

java.io.IOException - IO Error

IllegalDataDefinition - if the class of data was not registered (see registerClass(Class))

java.lang.NullPointerException - if data is null










unwrap


public java.lang.Object unwrap(RecvSimObjectData dataPacket)




Unwrap data, i.e. build an object instance from a received response packet.





Parameters:
dataPacket - data packet

Returns:
value of object, or null if it cannot be build for instance if the response packet does not corresponds to a managed request










unwrap


public <T> T unwrap(java.lang.Class<T> cl,
                    RecvSimObjectData data)
         throws IllegalDataDefinition




Unwrap data, i.e. build an object instance from a received response packet.





Parameters:
data - data packet
cl - class

Returns:
value of object, or null if it cannot be build for instance if the response packet does not corresponds to a managed request

Throws:

IllegalDataDefinition - if the given class is not managed by this wrapper










unwrapToObject


public java.lang.Object unwrapToObject(java.lang.Object o,
                                       RecvSimObjectData data)
                                throws IllegalDataDefinition




Unwrap data, i.e. fill an object instance fields from a received response packet.





Parameters:
data - data packet
o - fresh instance to fill

Returns:
value of object, or null if it cannot be build for instance if the response packet does not corresponds to a managed request

Throws:

IllegalDataDefinition - if the class of o is not managed by this wrapper

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - from reflection API (bad field type?)
